storyInfo: Gavial visits a Sargonian city and learns about a doctor who is offering candy that can treat Oripathy in exchange for blood. She decides to check things out...

attributes.content: Thank you, Dr. Gavial.
attributes.name: Slum Dweller

attributes.content: I feel a little better now.
attributes.name: Slum Dweller

attributes.content: Sorry... This is all I can do.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: It's okay. Not like there's a cure for Oripathy. Every day I live is a bonus.
attributes.name: Slum Dweller

attributes.content: I'm new in town. Is there a doctor here who's knowledgeable about Oripathy?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: What is it?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Well, a Sarkaz doctor came here a few months ago and bought out some ruins on the west end.
attributes.name: Slum Dweller

attributes.content: She told people she had candy that could cure Oripathy.
attributes.name: Slum Dweller

attributes.content: She handed it out in exchange for a test tube's worth of blood.
attributes.name: Slum Dweller

attributes.content: People believed that?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Not in the beginning, but some were desperate enough to send their children there. When the children actually started getting better, people started to believe.
attributes.name: Slum Dweller

attributes.content: Normally, that would have been the end of the story...
attributes.name: Slum Dweller

attributes.content: But there have been rumors in the slums about a missing child.
attributes.name: Slum Dweller

attributes.content: Missing... you think that doctor did it?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: The last person who saw the kid said she went to the doctor.
attributes.name: Slum Dweller

attributes.content: Why didn't anyone confront her?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: We're afraid... Those who have been to that place say it's full of blood bags.
attributes.name: Slum Dweller

attributes.content: She's a nasty character, too. Feels like she could start killing people any time.
attributes.name: Slum Dweller

attributes.content: Why not report her to the lord ameer?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: ...The nobility couldn't care less about a homeless child gone missing.
attributes.name: Slum Dweller

attributes.content: I'll go, then.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Are you really going?
attributes.name: Slum Dweller

attributes.content: I want to see if that doctor can really treat Oripathy.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: If she's a fake who's been kidnapping children... she'll get what's coming to her.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: The room is so decrepit that Gavial thought she had come to the wrong place at first.
No, there's a smell...
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: This is...
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: The smell of blood.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: She takes one step forward and kicks something.
She looks down.
It is a shoe, without a doubt that of a child.
There is a pool of dried blood next to it.
She feels the hairs on the back of her neck stand up.
What happened here?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: She bends down and sniffs the blood.
This is real blood, alright.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Did a kid really die here?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: She notices a candy next to the pool of blood.
Is this the candy that the doctor's handing out?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: It's... a plain old ordinary candy.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Tricking kids with candy, huh...
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Who's there?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Gavial looks up to see a girl standing at the top of the stairs, staring down at her.
Hey, kiddo. Can you tell me what happened here?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Wait!
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Hmph—
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Just what is going on here?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: You again?
Wait!
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: No need to be scared! I'm here to help you!
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: ...I see.
Are you the doctor who lives here?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Gavial has no time to be surprised at the blood bags hanging everywhere, for there is a Sarkaz with white hair and red eyes standing in front of her.
A Vampire. She remembers reading about them in a book.
A tribe of the Sarkaz, as powerful as they are infamous.
They walk in shadows, feeding upon the blood of others. There is no murder they will not commit, no evil they will not stoop to...
Y—You're a Vampire?!
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: I get it now. You use candy to lure children here so you can feed on them!
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: And who might you be?
attributes.name: Evil Vampire

attributes.content: I'm Gavial. Doctor Gavial. I'm here to expose your evil plot!
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: I don't have time for you right now. Sleep.
attributes.name: Evil Vampire

attributes.content: What... did you... do to me...?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Just fiddled with your blood circulation.
attributes.name: Evil Vampire

attributes.content: Be a good girl and nap for a while.
attributes.name: Evil Vampire

attributes.content: I... I feel like I'm burning...
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: You're still standing after being hit by my Arts.
attributes.name: Evil Vampire

attributes.content: Intriguing.
attributes.name: Evil Vampire

attributes.content: Who are you?
attributes.name: Evil Vampire

attributes.content: I said... my name... is Gavial...
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: That's... Doctor... Gavial...
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: I came to save this girl—argh!
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: You broke free. Most intriguing...
attributes.name: Evil Vampire

attributes.content: Most intriguing indeed.
attributes.name: Evil Vampire

attributes.content: What I wouldn't give for your blood—
attributes.name: Evil Vampire

attributes.content: Let her go?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: As you wish.
attributes.name: Evil Vampire

attributes.content: The Vampire's hand brushes against top of the girl's head, and she immediately loses consciousness, collapsing by the Vampire's feet.
What did you do to her?!
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: I'm saving her for dinner. Don't worry, she won't feel any pain.
attributes.name: Evil Vampire

attributes.content: You... you monster!
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: If you want to save her, we can make a trade.
attributes.name: Evil Vampire

attributes.content: A trade?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Yes. You let me draw your blood in her stead, and I'll let her go. How about that?
attributes.name: Evil Vampire

attributes.content: Sure.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: That was fast.
attributes.name: Evil Vampire

attributes.content: She might get hurt if I fought you right here.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: But you'd better keep your promise and let her go.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Otherwise, I won't ever forgive you, even if I die here today!
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: How do you plan on not forgiving me when you're about to die?
attributes.name: Evil Vampire

attributes.content: The tribe shaman says that when the heroes of Acahualla die, their souls go back to Acahualla's lakes.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: 'My soul shall be cleansed by the lake and become the wind in the trees, the rain in the sky.'
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: It's you who should be afraid, Vampire scum.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: You'll remember me when the wind brushes against your face and the rain falls upon your shoulders!
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: The tribes of Sargon have such delightful traditions.
attributes.name: Evil Vampire

attributes.content: But you don't understand the Vampires.
attributes.name: Evil Vampire

attributes.content: The wind is averted by the smell of blood, and the rain turns to blood that nourishes me.
attributes.name: Evil Vampire

attributes.content: Your soul won't harm me in the slightest.
attributes.name: Evil Vampire

attributes.content: Seething with rage, Gavial closes her eyes, ready to meet her death.
Before she left the jungle, Gavial thought the most glaring thing that existed was the sun.
Once, she mustered the courage to stare directly at the sun, and it burned her eyes, leaving her seeing double for days.
She thought there could be nothing more glaring that the sun.
She realized she was wrong when she left the jungle.
The most glaring thing is the eyes of other people, staring at the Originium crystals on her body.
She was not afraid of the malice in those eyes, but they are always averted when she tries to look into them.
It took some time for her to learn that her illness was known as 'Oripathy', rather than 'Stone Disease'. And people like her were known as 'Infected'.
She learned that Oripathy was considered incurable.
She learned that most Infected lead hard lives.
In the jungle, there was no such distinction, no discrimination against those afflicted by Oripathy.
She did not understand why. All she knew was that she might be able to make the lives of Oripathy patients better, even if it could never be cured.
So she searched for doctors who claimed to be able to treat Oripathy, trying to learn from them.
But she found only disappointment.
Some were mere frauds. Others were worse, using the treatment of Oripathy patients as a cover for criminal activity.
When she pointed it out, they framed her and made her a fugitive.
Why?
She feels the pain of a needle going into her arm, then the feeling of loss as her blood is drawn.
Her friends in Acahualla do not even know what happened to her.
She should have gone back to see them, just once.
The sense of loss is soon gone.
Then, silence.
Is this death?
Do Vampires kill painlessly?
No. She is still alive!
Your blood is surprisingly healthy, despite the high concentration of Originium crystals.
attributes.name: Evil Vampire

attributes.content: I knew it. You really are a remarkable physical specimen.
attributes.name: Evil Vampire

attributes.content: You're not going to kill me?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Why would I kill you? I said let me draw your blood in her stead.
attributes.name: Evil Vampire

attributes.content: But... you're a Vampire, aren't you...? Isn't drawing blood the same as killing?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Some of my kind like to do that, but I'm not interested.
attributes.name: Evil Vampire

attributes.content: Why do you do it, then?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: You freed yourself from my Arts by sheer willpower. I'm very interested in your blood.
attributes.name: Evil Vampire

attributes.content: But fighting you would be quite bothersome, so I improvised.
attributes.name: Evil Vampire

attributes.content: Thank you for your cooperation.
attributes.name: Evil Vampire

attributes.content: Who are you?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: You may call me Warfarin. Doctor Warfarin.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: Wake up, kiddo.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Mm... hm?
attributes.name: Infected Girl

attributes.content: Did you come to get treated too?
attributes.name: Infected Girl

attributes.content: I came looking for you.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Everyone thought you went missing.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: I didn't.
attributes.name: Infected Girl

attributes.content: The doctor told me I was too weak and needed to rest, so I didn't go out.
attributes.name: Infected Girl

attributes.content: So... you weren't tricking them with candy?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Some people wouldn't even believe that a Vampire could become a doctor. You can't convince these people to believe something that exceeds their capacity for imagination.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: You don't try to clear things up?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: I stopped caring about how people felt centuries ago.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: I would rather spend my time studying blood.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: Thank you, doctor. I feel much better.
attributes.name: Infected Girl

attributes.content: You give me blood, I give you medicine. Give and take, that's all.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: Now run along home. I have research to do, and I don't want to be bothered.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: Alright! Bye, doctor!
attributes.name: Infected Girl

attributes.content: Wait, the candy—
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Yes, it's just ordinary candy.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: But if the patient believes it will work, then it will work.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: We call that a 'placebo'.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: But it's lying, isn't it?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Can you give them medicine that works?
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: There is no cure for Oripathy. No reason to not lie, if it helps the patient live a little longer.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: The ultimate aim of treatment is to mitigate the patient's suffering. Never mind lying; I would gladly become a demon, if that's what it took for the treatment.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: Not that I expect you to understand.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: Now begone, and don't bother me again.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: I see! That makes so much sense!
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: What? You believe it?
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: Of course! It makes perfect sense.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Unless you're still tricking me?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: ...I'm telling the truth. Not many would believe it.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: Why? You're absolutely right.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Doctors can't make miracles. I don't care if the patient hates my guts, as long as they get better.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: ...I didn't expect you to be so understanding.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: Dr. Warfarin! No, Master Warfarin! I've been searching for a doctor like you, someone who can really teach me how to heal!
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Can you teach me about medicine?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: It's not every day that I meet someone who understands me like this. I suppose I could teach you a thing or two about medicine.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: But I don't want my blood research interrupted.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: You're interested in my blood, right?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: You can take my blood! Study it all you want!
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Well, I've already drawn plenty for my purposes.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: Anything troubling you? I could help you take care of it.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Now that you mention it... there is one thing.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: What is it?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: A lack of samples.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: At the end of the day, only a number of simpletons would believe this blood-for-candy thing.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: There are still many Infected who don't trust me.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: Besides, you said that rumors about me have started to spread, making it even less likely that people will come.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: Before you came, I was planning to make my identity known, and go door-to-door to scare the inhabitants into giving blood.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: You don't think it's a good idea?
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: Well, I think it's a little too slow.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Even counting me, it's no small task to draw blood from so many people with just the two of us.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: You have a point.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: ...Aha!
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: What is it?
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: Leave it to me, Master.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Will you train me in medicine if I solve your problem?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Certainly.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: A few days later...
Gavial hasn't been back for a few days.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: Did she run into some sort of trouble?
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: I would have taught her medicine, even if she didn't solve my problem.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: Maybe I should go and find her.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: Master Warfarin!
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: What took you so long?
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: Here.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Care to explain all the blood bags?
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: Well, I do some volunteer medical work in the slums, which means the people there are willing to hear me out.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: They were willing to give their blood when I told them you needed it for their research.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Oh, and I cleared up the rumors about you while I was at it.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Is this enough for your research?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Plenty.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: I've also logged the records, following the sample that you gave me for reference.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Here's the logbook.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: ...Very good. Very good indeed.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: Will you train me in medicine now?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: I never thought I would encounter a woman who's not only after my own heart, but one who can also do the things I can't.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: If only I had met you earlier! I would never have had to worry a lack of samples.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: You can count on me!
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: I've made up my mind, Gavial.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: Let's travel together and study the blood of Oripathy patients in different places.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: You'll collect the blood, and I'll study it.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: I'll teach you everything about medicine that I know.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: Awesome!
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Where exactly do you think you are going, Warfarin?
K—Kal'tsit?!
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: How did you find this place?!
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: I had already zeroed in on this area as your likely hiding spot.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Then I heard about a doctor talking about another Vampire doctor treating patients.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Let's just say it wasn't hard.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I forgot how well-connected you are.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: You've been away from your post for three months.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I mean, I've been sending back my research reports on a monthly basis! It's not like I've been doing nothing.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: There are certain things that require your physical presence.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: It's time for you to come back.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Who are you?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: My name is Kal'tsit, Warfarin's colleague. I'm here to bring her back. What about you?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I'm Gavial. Doctor Gavial!
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Warfarin said she'd train me in medicine if I helped her.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Are you taking her away? But we were just about to set out—
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Yes! Gavial and I were about to set out on a journey!
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: Construction has begun on the blood bank that you requested. You said you wanted to supervise it personally, didn't you?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: What?!
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: You should have told me earlier! I would have gone back so long ago!
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: Looks like our travel plans are going on hold, Gavial.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: B—But what do I do?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Sorry...
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: What is this place you two are talking about?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: It's called Rhodes Island. It's a pharmaceutical company dedicated to the treatment of Oripathy.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Are there a lot of people like Warfarin who can teach me more about medicine there?!
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Of course.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Can I come with you if Warfarin's going back?
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Now there's an idea. This one's a special talent, Kal'tsit, I guarantee it.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: Did you collect all these blood bags by yourself?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: This logbook...
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Hey, when did that end up in your hands?
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: Let me see... very detailed data, accompanied by appropriate comments and summaries.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: There is an entrance test you'll have to take, but you'll quality for a clerical position on the strength of this logbook alone.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: But I want to learn medicine!
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: You'll have no shortage of opportunities if you come to Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Before that, though, I have a question for you.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Why do you want to join Rhodes Island?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Because I want to cure everyone of Oripathy!
attributes.name: Gavial

attributes.content: Welcome aboard, Gavial.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit
